questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes a sandbox?
questions.answer_description: Options C and B are also correct, but A is more general and incorporates them both. D is incorrect, because sandboxing does not take place in the production environment.

choices.A: An isolated space where untested code and experimentation can safely occur separate from the production environment.
choices.C: An isolated space where transactions are protected from malicious software
choices.B: A space where you can safely execute malicious code to see what it does.
choices.D: An isolated space where untested code and experimentation can safely occur within the production environment.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. An isolated space where untested code and experimentation can safely occur separate from the production environment.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a regulatory system from the United States federal government?

discussion.content: Agree A - this is a card industry regulatory

questions.answer_description: The payment card industry data security standard (PCI DSS) pertains to organizations that handle credit card transactions and is an industry regulatory standard, not a governmental one.

questions.question_text: A localized incident or disaster can be addressed in a cost-effective manner by using which of the following?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A Joint Operating Agreement (JOA) is a cost-effective way to address localized incidents or disasters by allowing organizations to share resources, facilities, and operational responsibilities in the event of a disruption. This strategy reduces costs while ensuring business continuity by leveraging partnerships with other entities.

ðŸ”¹ Why Joint Operating Agreements?
âœ” Provides access to backup resources without requiring full duplication of infrastructure.
âœ” Ensures operational continuity by leveraging shared agreements with other organizations.
âœ” Reduces financial burden compared to maintaining dedicated backup facilities.

Selected Answer: C
C. Joint operating agreements

Joint operating agreements
A multi-party contract used to govern the relationship between members of a consortium engaged in an oil & gas project. A JOA is a way for co-venturers to apportion liability in accordance with their agreed participating interest.
how is this relevant to ccsp ?

questions.answer_description: A UPS can provide line conditioning, adjusting power so that it is optimized for the devices it serves and smoothing any power fluctuations; it does not offer any of the other listed functions.

discussion.content: Surge protection might be better wording

Selected Answer: D
D. Line conditioning

questions.question_text: In addition to battery backup, a UPS can offer which capability?

questions.answer_description: Print spooling is not a metric for system performance; all the rest are.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Print spooling
